The #SLWP Beddington Incinerator üè≠ continues to breach the @EnvAgency permit. 

üì∞Report just published shows: On 4th Oct that the CO Carbon Monoxide went over the permitted limit with a reading as high as 4161mg/m3!

Turning it off for the rest of day went over daily average. https://t.co/1PeRqFxpuE

Leave this with you. You decide if its acceptable that rivers are treated like open sewers. The last 12 months I've filmed more sanitary products than fish underwater. The great sanitary migration is coming soon.
#Pollution #sewage #environment #rivers https://t.co/ju5B8Dve45

The @EnvAgencyMids Boston #HavenBanks Improvement Scheme is getting winter ready. So far, progress on the project includes building up the core section of the banks with clay & adding new topsoil, & spreading grass seed for over 5km from the #BostonBarrier down to the Wash. https://t.co/tdpONgVgae

Research by experts @EngineeringNCL & @NorthumbrianH2O to identify traces of Covid-19 in sewage is helping to give early warning of local outbreaks & supporting public health teams   https://t.co/r3mcQP3ny4 @EnvAgencyYNE

urls.title: Sewage signals early warning of coronavirus outbreaks
urls.description: Government-led programme is providing an early warning of coronavirus outbreaks by monitoring sewage and sharing data with NHS Test & Trace

tweets.text:
The UK has made a breakthrough in using science to tackle #coronavirus.  

Scientists can now use sewage to detect local outbreaks, even when people don't show symptoms.  

Find out more: https://t.co/JEJxbjIMR0 

#CovidSewageTesting @DHSCgovuk @EnvAgency https://t.co/vW5ratcTmN

tweets.text: The Preston & South Ribble Flood Risk Scheme engagement site is live! Head on over to view our plans for the scheme and share your views on our proposals: https://t.co/Mfr47nMenU https://t.co/H2Sw4nihmz
@CossieRob @EnvAgency I‚Äôm not talking about the sewage testing.

@DanHolden85 @WandleForum @thameswater @Wandle_Trust @Feargal_Sharkey @EnvAgency Yes. Good to check though. @WandleForum has reported it to the EA and Thames Water. Hopefully we'll have an update soon ish. Transparency is key.
@WandleForum @thameswater @Wandle_Trust @Feargal_Sharkey @LDNWaterkeeper I'm assuming someone had contacted the @EnvAgency ??
@buttery_simon @GroundControlGC @EnvAgency Stunning photos!
@DrGonzo1985 @EnvAgency PCR testing of sewage. Is that what they are using?
@CossieRob @EnvAgency Can you be a more specific? I dare say it‚Äôs mentioned in a lot of places.
@DrGonzo1985 @EnvAgency Where is the testing methodology mentioned?
@CossieRob @EnvAgency By the government‚Äôs own admission the PCR has a 93% false positive rate. I‚Äôm not expecting 100% but 93% false positive is taking the piss.
@DrGonzo1985 @EnvAgency It‚Äôs a novel (new) virus. The data is being learned as we go. But wanting 100% certainly is foolish. In anyway, shape or form.

A very welcome announcement this morning & I'm very proud that #TeamEA are part of this important breakthrough in the fight against #COVID__19 

Thank you & well done to all colleagues & partners for working together and saving lives.

#CovidSewageTesting #coronavirus @EnvAgency https://t.co/SabOoAp7yA

tweets.text: @DrGonzo1985 @EnvAgency I‚Äôm saying sewage sampling results aren‚Äôt leading the way.
@CossieRob @EnvAgency So you‚Äôre saying the government‚Äôs policies aren‚Äôt being lead by the data they receive?
@DrGonzo1985 @EnvAgency Supporting, not directing or leading.

One channel is a rare urban chalk stream. The other channel is the outflow from @thameswater's sewage works at Beddington. You decide. @Wandle_Trust @Feargal_Sharkey @LDNWaterkeeper #Wandle https://t.co/n3hJoy7EyV

@CossieRob @EnvAgency It‚Äôs literally in the title of the article? The government will use that information to justify their policies. Where we are today is based on unreliable data. So I feel testing a large catchment area of human waste will not improve the situation.
@DrGonzo1985 @EnvAgency Who is using sewage sampling results to lock people down. Show me one example.

@CossieRob @EnvAgency My first comment was about the justification of locking healthy people up, now whether it‚Äôs your shit or you snot that they test, it shouldn‚Äôt be used to lock healthy people up if the testing isn‚Äôt reliable.
@DrGonzo1985 @EnvAgency Maybe so but you‚Äôre commenting on a thread from the Environment Agency talking about sewage.

@CossieRob @EnvAgency I‚Äôm not talking about sewage testing. I‚Äôm talking about the current PCR test with a reliability that is laughable being used to justify locking people up. That‚Äôs why we‚Äôre seeing so many people testing positive who don‚Äôt have any symptoms. PCR tests for damaged RNA not viral load

tweets.text: @DrGonzo1985 @EnvAgency Nobody is getting locked up for trial sewage testing. And 100% reliable testing isn‚Äôt always immediate.
